1.text: Then Eliphaz the Temanite answered and said,

2.text: Can a man be profitable to God, as he that is wise may be profitable to himself?

3.text: Is it any pleasure to the Almighty, that you are righteous? or is it gain to him, that you make your ways perfect?

4.text: Will he reprove you for fear of you? will he enter with you into judgment?

5.text: Is not your wickedness great? and your iniquities infinite?

6.text: For you have taken a pledge from your brother for nothing, and stripped the naked of their clothing.

7.text: You have not given water to the weary to drink, and you have withheld bread from the hungry.

8.text: But as for the mighty man, he had the earth; and the honorable man dwelled in it.

9.text: You have sent widows away empty, and the arms of the fatherless have been broken.

10.text: Therefore snares are round about you, and sudden fear troubles you;

11.text: Or darkness, that you can not see; and abundance of waters cover you.

12.text: Is not God in the height of heaven? and behold the height of the stars, how high they are!

13.text: And you say, How does God know? can he judge through the dark cloud?

14.text: Thick clouds are a covering to him, that he sees not; and he walks in the circuit of heaven.

15.text: Have you marked the old way which wicked men have trodden?

16.text: Which were cut down out of time, whose foundation was overflowed with a flood:

17.text: Which said to God, Depart from us: and what can the Almighty do for them?

18.text: Yet he filled their houses with good things: but the counsel of the wicked is far from me.

19.text: The righteous see it, and are glad: and the innocent laugh them to scorn.

20.text: Whereas our substance is not cut down, but the remnant of them the fire consumes.

21.text: Acquaint now yourself with him, and be at peace: thereby good shall come to you.

22.text: Receive, I pray you, the law from his mouth, and lay up his words in your heart.

23.text: If you return to the Almighty, you shall be built up, you shall put away iniquity far from your tabernacles.

24.text: Then shall you lay up gold as dust, and the gold of Ophir as the stones of the brooks.

25.text: Yes, the Almighty shall be your defense, and you shall have plenty of silver.

26.text: For then shall you have your delight in the Almighty, and shall lift up your face to God.

27.text: You shall make your prayer to him, and he shall hear you, and you shall pay your vows.

28.text: You shall also decree a thing, and it shall be established to you: and the light shall shine on your ways.

29.text: When men are cast down, then you shall say, There is lifting up; and he shall save the humble person.

30.text: He shall deliver the island of the innocent: and it is delivered by the pureness of your hands.
